episodeTitle: Robin Freed! Luffy vs. Lucci, Showdown Between Leaders!
episodeTitleJapanese: ロビン解放！ルフィ対ルッチ頂上決戦
episodeTitleRomanized: Robin Kaihō! Rufi tai Rucchi chōjō kessen
description: Freed from her sea stone handcuffs, Robin regains her powers and fights alongside Franky. The Buster Call fleet arrives at Enies Lobby led by five Vice Admirals. Luffy continues his intense battle against Rob Lucci, but his Gear Second technique begins to wear off due to the immense physical strain on his body.

events.title: Robin Uses Powers After Being Freed
events.description: Now free from her sea stone handcuffs, Robin demonstrates her Devil Fruit abilities again, using her Hana Hana no Mi powers to take down Marines alongside Franky.
events.significance: Confirms Robin's return to full strength and her willingness to fight for her freedom.

events.title: Buster Call Fleet Arrives
events.description: The massive Buster Call fleet of ten Marine battleships arrives at Enies Lobby, led by five Vice Admirals: Doberman, Momonga, Onigumo, Strawberry, and Yamakaji. The overwhelming military force prepares to annihilate the island.
events.significance: Escalates the crisis to catastrophic levels, introducing the World Government's most devastating military operation and five powerful new Marine officers.

events.title: Vice Admiral Doberman's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Doberman makes his first appearance, distinguished by his X-shaped facial scars and ruthless demeanor. He commands one of the Buster Call battleships.
events.significance: Introduces a key Marine officer who embodies the concept of Absolute Justice.

events.title: Vice Admiral Momonga's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Momonga makes his first appearance as one of the Buster Call commanders, showing his serious and calculating nature.
events.significance: Introduces a skilled swordsman and powerful Vice Admiral who will play important roles in future arcs.

events.title: Vice Admiral Onigumo's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Onigumo makes his first appearance, identifiable by his stern expression and distinctive appearance.
events.significance: Introduces another powerful Marine officer participating in the Buster Call.

events.title: Vice Admiral Strawberry's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Strawberry makes his first appearance as part of the Buster Call command.
events.significance: Adds to the overwhelming Marine presence threatening Enies Lobby.

events.title: Vice Admiral Yamakaji's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Yamakaji makes his first appearance, completing the roster of five Vice Admirals leading the Buster Call.
events.significance: Completes the introduction of all five Vice Admirals commanding the devastating attack.

events.title: Buster Call Bombardment Begins
events.description: Vice Admiral Doberman orders his battleship to fire upon the Tower of Justice. The massive cannon blast destroys the upper portion of the tower, sending it crashing into the waterfall below. This opens the Gates of Justice and allows the Marine fleet direct access to Enies Lobby.
events.significance: The Buster Call officially begins its devastating assault, marking the point of no return for the Straw Hats' escape.

events.title: Lucci Deduces Gear Second's Mechanism
events.description: Rob Lucci figures out how Luffy's Gear Second technique works, explaining that Luffy is pumping his blood at an accelerated rate to enhance his speed and power. He notes this dangerous technique must be putting tremendous strain on Luffy's body.
events.significance: Reveals the biological cost of Gear Second and foreshadows the technique's impact on Luffy's lifespan.

quotes.text: I've figured out your technique. You're pumping your blood at an accelerated rate, forcing your body beyond its limits. But such a reckless method will destroy you.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci

events.title: Luffy Declares He'll Risk His Life for His Crew
events.description: When Lucci mocks him about the danger of Gear Second, Luffy declares that he doesn't care if the technique shortens his lifespan. He would rather die than let his crew be separated or harmed.
events.significance: Demonstrates the depth of Luffy's dedication to his crew and his willingness to sacrifice everything for them, a core theme of his character.

quotes.text: I don't care what it does to me! I'll use everything I have to protect my crew!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Responding to Lucci's warning about Gear Second's danger

events.title: Gear Second Effect Wears Off
events.description: Luffy's Gear Second enhancement completely wears off mid-battle, leaving him exhausted and panting heavily. His body returns to normal as the accelerated blood flow technique ends.
events.significance: Reveals the time limit and physical toll of Gear Second, creating a critical disadvantage in his fight against Lucci.

events.title: Underground Chamber Flooding
events.description: Rob Lucci deliberately tears a massive hole through the wall of the underground chamber where they're fighting, causing seawater to rush in. This floods the escape passage where other Straw Hats and allies are located, putting them in mortal danger.
events.significance: Creates a life-threatening situation for the Straw Hats trying to escape, raising the stakes of the battle.

events.title: Robin and Franky Plan to Capture Spandam's Ship
events.description: With no other escape route available due to the Buster Call, Robin and Franky decide to capture the ship that Spandam had prepared to transport Robin to Marine Headquarters. This becomes their only hope for escape.
events.significance: Establishes the escape plan that will be crucial for the Straw Hats' survival.

events.title: Luffy and Lucci's Battle Intensifies
events.description: Despite Gear Second wearing off, Luffy refuses to give up. The battle between Luffy and Rob Lucci continues to escalate as they exchange devastating blows in the crumbling Tower of Justice.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's unwavering determination even when at a disadvantage, setting up for the climax of their battle.

quotes.text: I've figured out your technique. You're pumping your blood at an accelerated rate, forcing your body beyond its limits. But such a reckless method will destroy you.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci

quotes.text: I don't care what it does to me! I'll use everything I have to protect my crew!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Declaring his willingness to risk his life for his crew

themes.description: Luffy's willingness to risk his lifespan and health through Gear Second demonstrates his absolute commitment to protecting his crew, embodying the theme of selfless sacrifice.
themes.symbolism: Gear Second's physical toll represents the price of strength and the sacrifices leaders must make for those they care about.

themes.description: The arrival of the Buster Call represents seemingly insurmountable odds, yet the Straw Hats continue to fight, showcasing the series' theme that willpower can overcome even the most overwhelming forces.
themes.symbolism: The massive Marine fleet symbolizes the World Government's absolute authority and military might.

themes.description: Robin's liberation from her handcuffs is juxtaposed with the catastrophic Buster Call, showing that freedom often comes at a tremendous cost.
themes.symbolism: The Tower of Justice being destroyed represents the breaking down of the World Government's absolute authority.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates the depth of his dedication to his crew, willing to sacrifice his own lifespan through Gear Second. He shows both the limits of his new technique and his determination to push past those limits.
keyActions: Continues fighting Lucci despite Gear Second wearing off
Declares willingness to risk his life for his crew
Pushes his body beyond its limits
quotes: I don't care what it does to me! I'll use everything I have to protect my crew!

characterSpotlights.development: Lucci demonstrates his analytical mind by deducing how Gear Second works, and his ruthlessness by deliberately flooding the underground chambers to endanger the other Straw Hats.
keyActions: Tears hole in chamber wall to flood escape routes
quotes: I've figured out your technique. You're pumping your blood at an accelerated rate, forcing your body beyond its limits. But such a reckless method will destroy you.

characterSpotlights.development: Finally free from her handcuffs, Robin actively fights for her freedom alongside Franky, showing her complete commitment to living.
keyActions: Uses Devil Fruit powers to fight Marines
Plans to capture Spandam's ship for escape

characterSpotlights.development: Franky continues to protect Robin and helps devise their escape plan, solidifying his role as a key ally to the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Plans escape route via Spandam's ship

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences and adds more reaction shots from the Vice Admirals that weren't in the manga.

trivia.fact: On the Marine battleships that appear in this episode, 'MARINE' is misspelled as 'MARNE' in several shots.
This episode marks the anime debut of five Vice Admirals who will all play important roles in the Marineford War arc: Doberman, Momonga, Onigumo, Strawberry, and Yamakaji.
The episode aired in Japan on March 25, 2007, with a TV rating of 7.4%, ranking 5th for the week.
This is one of the key episodes where Rob Lucci explicitly explains the danger of Gear Second, addressing fan questions about whether the technique actually shortens Luffy's lifespan.
